definition: to sunbathe/to tan/to get sunburnt/to expose unfair practices (on a consumer protection website)

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]

sentences.english: Today, I decided to try a self-tanning lotion my friend had recommended. I put it on, and decided to take a nap.
sentences.chinese: 今天我試用了一下朋友推薦的曬黑霜，然後去睡覺。

sentences.english: Her bare shoulders were burned by the sun.
sentences.chinese: 她裸露的肩膀被太陽曬黑了。

sentences.english: If you want a tan, move to Florida.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想曬黑，移居弗羅裏達吧。

sentences.english: Addicted to the infra-red glow of tanning salons? This word describes you.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺於皮膚曬黑沙龍的紅外光。

sentences.english: The skin reply that how the making with fast ability suntans is unvarnished ?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能快速的使曬黑的皮膚回覆原樣？

sentences.english: Can computer suntan the person's skin?
sentences.chinese: 電腦會把人的皮膚曬黑嗎？
爲什麼紅頭髮的人不適合曬黑？

sentences.english: You can not see my face clearly, because i get it browned again.
sentences.chinese: 你看不清我的臉，是因爲我又曬黑了。

sentences.english: If I am fair-skinned, can I tan at all?
sentences.chinese: 如果我皮膚白皙，我能曬黑嗎？

sentences.english: Jane tanned quickly in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 簡在太陽下很快就曬黑了。

sentences.english: How to make suntanned skin whiten?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼讓曬黑的皮膚變白吶？

sentences.english: Your acne meds and other drugs may help fry your skin.
sentences.chinese: 痤瘡膏或其他藥品也許會使皮膚曬黑加劇。

sentences.english: If you don't wear sunscreen, you are apt to get a sunburn.
sentences.chinese: 如果你沒有擦防曬，你很可能會曬黑。

sentences.english: Melanin darkens the skin and is the cause of suntan.
sentences.chinese: 黑色素使皮膚變黑是人被曬黑的原因。

sentences.english: How to use suntanned skin to bleach.
sentences.chinese: 怎樣使用曬黑的皮膚變白。

sentences.english: And avoid sunlamps and tanning booths.
sentences.chinese: 儘量避免使用日光燈和曬黑機。

definition: (of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to run around all over the place
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
